Assessment.QuestionText: Which of the following statements of the <font face="courier new">DataTable</font>, <font face="courier new">DataRelation</font>, <font face="courier new">DataColumn</font>, <font face="courier new">DataRow</font>, and <font face="courier new">DataTableReader</font> classes are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The <font face="courier new">DataTable</font> object is used as a case-sensitive object if the casing of two tables with same name differs.
The <font face="courier new">DataRow</font> and <font face="courier new">DataColumn</font> classes are used as the primary components of the <font face="courier new">DataTable</font> class.
The <font face="courier new">DataRelation</font> objects are used to enter duplicate values in a column of a table.
The <font face="courier new">DataRelation</font> objects are used to enforce referential integrity.
The <font face="courier new">DataTableReader</font> object is used to return the records of a table in editable mode.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(True), (B)-(True), (C)-(False), (D)-(True), and (E)-(False).
